quest.name: A Test of Courage
journal:
Kabuto is making ready to storm the Isle of Zekki.
※The difficulty of this quest will be synced to your current level.

Kabuto has every intention of rescuing Tsukumo, but he cannot do it alone. First, he must enlist the aid of his fellow Kojin. As he musters the courage to do so, he asks you to accompany him in case he should falter.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

One of Kabuto's brothers agrees to help much to his surprise. Though only a small success, it gives him courage. So much so, he asks you to wait with Bunchin while he takes on the monumental task of speaking with all the Kojin of Tamamizu.

Kabuto has done his due diligence and spoken with all his brothers. All that remains is to wait. Then wait. Then wait a while longer. Just as he was beginning to lose hope, the other members of the Divine Circle arrive. They each have taken steps to prepare for the upcoming battle, and their remaining brothers are all at the ready outside of Tamamizu. It is time for battle, and so Kabuto bids you follow him to the Dive.
The plan to distract the Red Kojin about the island was a success. The entrance is unguarded, and Kabuto is prepared to rush inside.

Together you and Kabuto fight your way through to the Air of the Opulent and at last find Tsukumo held captive by Hirumaki. A duel ensues, and the ringing of steel against steel is deafening. Alas, Kabuto appears to be no match for Hirumaki. The red-shelled swordsman prepares to deliver the finishing blow when Tsukumo struggles to speak. He offers a few words of encouragement before growing still, and Kabuto realizes at once what has happened. He then finds the strength to strike one last time. Hirumaki collapses to the ground, but Kabuto follows shortly after. With the general defeated, the other Blue Kojin carry the unmoving Tsukumo and Kabuto back to Tamamizu.

Tsukumo is no more. The doll sits silently on an altar in the treasure vault when Shihoumi arrives to examine it. Kabuto's hopes of saving Tsukumo are dashed, however, when she tells him there is nothing she can do. Feeling defeated, Kabuto casts a sullen look at the altar and notices a peculiar gem on the ground. Shihoumi is quick to identify it as materia, and wastes no time affixing it to Kabuto's helmet. Taking the materia as a parting gift, he vows to honor Tsukumo's memory by redoubling his efforts to serve the Divine Circle.
objectives: Speak with Kabuto at the Dive.
Harness the treasures' powers and make for the Air of the Opulent.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I'm afraid you've arrived early, Forename. There is still much to do before preparations are complete.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Yet I cannot stop thinking about Tsukumo's capture. Why strike in Kugane rather than here in Tamamizu? There is little we could have done to stop them had they tried.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Unless... What if this was not the work of the Red as a whole, but a plot by Hirumaki to satisfy his own greed?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Defeating him would be the key to rescuing Tsukumo.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: The problem, however, is he is always so heavily guarded.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Our plans and preparation will all be for nothing unless they can be drawn away.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: As ever your aid is greatly appreciated.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, we cannot deny their numbers. Sheer strength alone will not grant us victory.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: The other members of the Divine Circle intend to create a distraction to draw them away, but even then we are still outmatched.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: <sigh> How am I to sway my brothers to join us? Even the mere mention of the Isle of Zekki is enough to turn them away.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You must convince them with your actions.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You must convince them with a thorough explanation of your plan.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: My actions...? Ah, like the Qestir of the Azim Steppe.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Hmmm. That sounds like what Tsukumo would do. He always had a way with words.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: If that is what you believe, then I suppose it is worth a try.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Erm... Would you be willing to accompany me? Not to speak with everyone, of course. Only until I've gained my nerve.

dialogue.name: VOLUNTEER02977
dialogue.text: Aren't you the one aiding the Divine Circle in their search for treasure? You've done fine work for the Blue. Yes, fine work indeed.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Your presence is greatly appreciated. Ahem. Now then.

dialogue.name: VOLUNTEER02977
dialogue.text: Are you well, Kabuto? It's rather unlike you to call on anyone for help. I suppose next Makura will tell us the striped rays are drowning.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Tsukumo has been taken by the Red, and I mean to rescue him.

dialogue.name: VOLUNTEER02977
dialogue.text: So it is true! I had hoped it was only a rumor. But what are we to do? We are not fighters, Kabuto. You would be leading turtles to slaughter.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I realize that, which is why I will not ask you to fight. But I do have a plan that requires your help.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: You are perhaps the greatest swimmer the Ruby Sea has ever known, and your knowledge of its currents is unmatched. That is why I would ask you to lead their soldiers on a chase─distract them that I might do battle with their leader alone.

dialogue.name: VOLUNTEER02977
dialogue.text: A chase, you say? Hmmm. It should be simple enough to drag those sea slugs through the waves. It might even prove fun.

dialogue.name: VOLUNTEER02977
dialogue.text: Very well. Give me time to prepare and you will have your diversion.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: He listened. He listened and agreed to help! No doubt your presence helped to convince him.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: But I cannot ask you to be present for everyone. Wait with the elder while I speak with the others.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: Kabuto has taken to recruiting our brothers for his attack on the Isle of Zekki? It seems he has learned much from his time away from Tamamizu.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I never realized talking could be so tiresome.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: I take it you have spoken with everyone, then. Fear not. Your cause is just, and from what Forename has told me, your plan is sound.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: We need only wait for the others to assemble.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: It would seem my words have fallen on deaf ears. Come, Forename. We must save Tsukumo on our own.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: You are too quick to judge your brothers, Kabuto. Take another look.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Sorry to keep you waiting. I thought it prudent we have proper weapons should we be forced to confront the Red, so I made a short trip to visit the Qestir.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: You traveled all the way to Reunion for weapons!?

dialogue.name: SHIKITAHE
dialogue.text: I paid a visit to the forge in Kugane, and the young smith─Shihoumi, I believe is her name─insisted she be brought here to prepare for Tsukumo's return. She seemed quite adamant about seeing to his repairs.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Shihoumi! I had nearly forgotten. I know not how to repay you.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: When a brother is in need, we help. It's as simple as that.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Just so. In fact, you'll find more of our brothers are waiting for you outside. Everyone is prepared to do their part to see Tsukumo returned safely.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Which is why I scouted ahead, lest we have any unwanted surprises. I overheard the soldiers on watch speaking of Hirumaki.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: They say he's been gloating over his latest plunder, keeping it on display at the Air of the Opulent. It has to be Tsukumo.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Then I know where I must go.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, your task will be to circle about the island and draw the attention of as many soldiers as you can.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: While they're distracted, Forename and I will sneak onto the island through the Dive.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: Today we shall prove the Blue are not to be trifled with.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: To the Isle of Zekki!

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: You needn't worry about me. I may be old, but with age comes great wisdom. I know enough of battle to handle myself in the field.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: You're here. Good. Everyone is in position.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: When we reach the Air of the Opulent, I will see to Hirumaki while you retrieve Tsukumo.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Are you ready?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: There! It's Hirumaki, and he has Tsukumo!

dialogue.name: SHIKITAHE
dialogue.text: The soldiers are all taking to the water. Now is your chance.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Thank you. All of you. I promise this opportunity will not be wasted.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Fall back and join the others. Forename will handle the rest.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Understood. Good luck, and may the kami keep you safe.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: We have faith in you, Kabuto.

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: So you've come after all. Shaugi, why don't you entertain our guests?

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: With pleasure.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Come, Forename. He stands no chance against the both of us.

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: I've had enough of your meddling! I will rip your heads from your shoulders and mount them on the walls of the vault!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Hurry, Forename. See to Tsukumo!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Prepare yourself!

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: Is that the best you can do?

dialogue.name: HIRUMAKI
dialogue.text: This is your last chance. Join me or die along with the rest of the Blue.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Ugh...

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: ThE oThErS...cOuNtInG oN yOu...

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: My WoRk...iS DoNe. FoLlOw...YoUr HeArT.

dialogue.name: TSUKUMO
dialogue.text: I wIlL...aLwAyS...

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Tsukumo!!!

dialogue.name: REDZAKO02977
dialogue.text: (-Red Kojin Soldiers-)General Hirumaki has fallen! Retreat! Retreat!

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: Quickly. We must take him back to Tamamizu.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I apologize if I've worried you. I am fine, but there is still no change in Tsukumo.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: He's remained lifeless since he last spoke on the Isle of Zekki.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Shihoumi. Can you repair him?

dialogue.name: SHIHOUMI
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. There doesn't seem to be anything wrong with him, physically.

dialogue.name: SHIHOUMI
dialogue.text: I could grant him movement, but only such as an ordinary karakuri puppet might have.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Tsukumo is no ordinary puppet. He is of the divine!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Forename. You have dealt with matters of magic before, yes? Do you know of anything that might restore Tsukumo?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: But why? He has already served his purpose.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: But why? Have you forgotten Tsukumo's parting message?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: How can you say that? There's still so much we've yet to do.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: His parting message? You say that as if his intention was to leave.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: What's this? Did it fall from Tsukumo's altar?

dialogue.name: SHIHOUMI
dialogue.text: How could I have overlooked such a thing while examining him? Hmmm. It bears a striking resemblance to materia...

dialogue.name: SHIHOUMI
dialogue.text: Of course! Materia is essentially spiritual energy in crystallized form. It was likely used to make Tsukumo's core.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN000
dialogue.text: Are you saying it was this materia that gave him life?

dialogue.name: SHIHOUMI
dialogue.text: Precisely. And I have an idea as to how we may still put it to use. Would you sit down for a moment?

dialogue.name: SHIHOUMI
dialogue.text: A perfect fit.

dialogue.name: SHIHOUMI
dialogue.text: It suits your helmet quite nicely.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Shihoumi. I will treasure it always.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Tsukumo. You lent your voice when I could not find my own, your courage when I had only cowardice.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Thanks to you, I now understand the strength that comes from the bonds I share with others.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Before I might have thrown this materia away, but now...

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Now I would honor Tsukumo's memory by protecting the vault, and the allies that have helped us fill it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Thanks to your concerted efforts with Kabuto, Tsukumo now rests peacefully in the treasure vault.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Sworn reputation with the Kojin.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you will receive an experience point bonus upon the completion of the Kojin tribal daily quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New Kojin tribal daily quests are now available from Zukin at Tamamizu.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: The path is clear. Come, this way!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: What is he doing here?

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: I brought treasures from the vault to aid you. Align yourself with the kami within and they shall grant you their blessings.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I... I've never felt such power! With this we should have all we need to stop any in our way.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: Makura waits for you within bearing more of our treasures. Go now, and may the kami protect you.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Onward, to the Air of the Opulent!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: By the kami! They should be out in the water, not here fighting. We have to help them!

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Kabuto! Forename! Thank goodness you're here.

dialogue.name: VOLUNTEER02977
dialogue.text: That seems to be the last of them. We'll keep the way clear. Hurry and save Tsukumo!

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Before you go, come and partake of this treasure's blessing.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Thank you. I fear we will need it for what lies ahead.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Go quickly now. We will keep them at bay for as long as we can.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text:
Thank you, Makura.
Come, Forename. We mustn't waste this opportunity.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Curses! I wasn't expecting such numbers.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: If they would stand against us, then we have no choice. Lead on, Forename.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Draw them together, and I will deliver the finishing blow!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Reinforcements!? Distract them that I might strike again.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: There's no end to them! I fear I only have strength enough for one last attack.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Well done. Now let's get moving. It shouldn't be much farther.

dialogue.name: ENEMY
dialogue.text: Intruders! Stop them!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I...can't move. Forename, help!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I'm free! Now to dispense with these red-shelled fiends.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: The Air of the Opulent is just ahead. Once inside you mustn't let down your guard.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: Wait, Kabuto! We've prepared one last treasure to aid you in your fight against Hirumaki.

dialogue.name: MAKURA
dialogue.text: It's right around this corner.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: With this last blessing we should have all the strength we need. Let's put an end to Hirumaki and his schemes.

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: How dare you raise your blade against General Hirumaki. Yours will be a slow and painful death!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: If we're to save Tsukumo he has to be stopped.

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: Hmph. Let's see how you handle this!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Quickly! We must destroy these spheres before they burst.

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: We will suffer your intrusion no longer!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: To me, Forename! We must bear this attack together.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Gah! For a blessing I survived, but I dare not suffer another alone.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: It will take more than some feeble spring shower to defeat us, Shaugi.

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: I've had enough of this wet nurse of yours. Begone with you!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: His strength is waning, Forename. Keep it up!

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: Fools! You cannot defeat the Red!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: The water spouts─they're protecting him!

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: Enough games. This time I will end you!

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: Why! Why won't you die!?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: It seems the tide has turned in our favor.

dialogue.name: SYAGI
dialogue.text: Forgive me... General...

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: No... Not like this...
